item.title: IP Addresses
item.description: This is in the third layer of the OSI model that is Network, related to routing. Inet = IPv4, decimal notation Inet6 = IPv6, hexadecimal notation IPv4 192.168.57.139 Each group before the dot is an octect, made by 8 bits, representing 1 and 0, and made all up together conforms 32 bits and that is equivalent to 4 bytes.

item.title: TCP vs UDP
item.description: TCP, UDP, and the three-way handshake Both are layer 4 of the OSI model, that is transport, so this protocols covers the transport of packets to the application. TCP TCP = Transmission control protocol
